title: Bronze breaks your will to play.. advice?
body:
They say that the definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results... 
That seems to be a statement that heavily applies to the bronze ranked divisions. I'm sure there are a million discussions like this but i was hoping to maybe gain some insight from some players that have been in similar circumstances.

To give a little bit of background I would say I am a some what mediocre player, last season I finished in silver V after carrying myself out of bronze.
I wouldn't say my ranked stats are anything too special but In most cases I find myself doing better than my team mates/making plays, nonetheless there is a clear level of skill and understanding difference between me and the average bronze player so it seems, my previous game I found myself needing to constantly warn my team mates about various basic fundamentals to league "we cant contest drag they are 10 kills ahead and 1 person up on us", "Rengar you need to stop chasing people half the distance of the map otherwise their team will just keep killing you"
I suppose this is more of a rant but it is frustrating to be in this position, especially when I give golds/platinum players a run for their money on occasion when i play norms. Most normal games I have really decent scores (so long as I'm not playing something like Zed support heh) but as most do, i take ranked more serious than norms and at times have real trouble turning games if some of my team mates are just utterly clueless or AFK for whatever reason, it is fair to say that my scores plummet more than they usually would in these particular games due to trying to salvage as much as I possibly can from a failed team fight. Regardless I understand some games cannot be won..

So I guess what I am asking is what worked for those of you that climbed out of bronze? what strategies did you use? 
Often I am taking steps to improve my play and support my team mates.. granted they are open to listening (often not the case in bronze)
I invest a decent amount of time into this game, i love playing it, love watching it. but overall knowing that I am bronze frustrates the sht out of me. 

Main jungle/support
http://www.lolking.net/summoner/oce/1474394#ranked-stats 

Take care guys

replies.body:
Often the weakest link in bronze is the ADC. If you are serious about escaping bronze I would suggest picking up this role and specialising in it (as well as your already good jungle and support skills). 
Climbing out of bronze is also a matter of being patient, especially with those who aren't doing so well or aren't listening to your advice. Communicating openly and constantly with your team is key, using smart pings to try and increase map awareness (something bronze players often lack).
Anyways... Good luck, i'm sure you can climb out of bronze eventually
Especially because bronze is usually last pick, people who get stuck with it hate it and build 'carry support' often not itemising to cover the teams weaknesses/ actually warding the map.

One thing I noticed, your get locket in every game. Often better to get other items, especially vs teams with heavier AD comps. Rushing it 2nd item on pantheon, is not gud. Im not exactly sure, but I think double brut randuin hexdrinker is pantheon build atm?
better, get banner instead of locket. its infinitely better.
The locket active is pretty good for things like fiddle, kat.

vs those, with little push power/split push power and literally 0 anti siege....the empowered minion would greatly destroy them. creating pressure across the map, making it less beneficial to them to try to use their flank gank power. because if your team doesnt all get wiped (easy if you have 2 banners giving auras at every part of a fight vs their magic damage) and you just stall out a little bit, BAM, 2 towers and an inhib for free....or wait, they send someone to deal with the big wave and huge cannon...bam, free dragon or baron or 5 vs 4 in your favor.

overall, banner is better vs those picks than say....zed or other AD mids. there are some AP mids that also do better vsing banners than lockets, like ori or other utility mids. but essentially, surprise burst like kat and fiddle, they lose out to the split push power of the minion and the burst shield (that is TINY TINY TINY) is barely noticeable.
Banner I have noticed is nice on shen. I use the active before I ult into a teamfight.
thats actually a really good idea, sync up their use since ult is about the same CD. lol

You have a few options here.
1. Choose ADC or a very important role that you can carry in and hope for the best.
2. Get boosted.
3. Don't touch ranked at all and wait until Pre-Season to get your MMR up.
4. Uninstall LoL.
5. New Account.
Lol i was in bronze 3 for a year because i didn't feel like playing ranked, then i power leveled to silver 3 within a month
I wouldn't complain about dropping from Silver 5 to Bronze 2. I dropped from Gold 4 to Bronze 1 LOL
Haha I personally find bronze relaxing and hilarious, dunno what is so bad about it aside from bragging rights.

For me I find it frustrating as hell doing the best that I can but being held back by X issue that occurs in game, that i don't usually see happening in streams of higher elo etc. I had a really decent promotion series hard carrying 5 games out of the 10 i won then i get bronze 2. 
A little daunting considering how difficult it can be. Friend feeds every game goes 2/8 gets silver 4? things like that are a little frustrating

Haha just enjoy your time man, if you get frustrated you could go on tilt and lose more. Treat the game like what it was meant to be and have fun. I know I am a "casual", but last season I got lucky and ended up with a silver 1 elo somehow, and found it very stressful as everyone was around from my level to much much higher, and I gotta tell you it ain't the funnest experience when you win but usually rely on roaming around, helping to feed your other lanes before they hard carry the rest of the game.

This season I got 2/8 in my provisionals and am now in b4. I personally find the gameplay down here much more relaxing and "casual", and trust me, enjoying the game can seriously help with your performance, and at least have fun in the games even when you lose. To be honest, the only motivation I even have to climb ranked is for the free skin in gold :P
fight Cancer with cancer, pick himer top exhaust/ignite + tele, then build zhonyas, zzrot portal, banner of command, never leave top till u have their inhib. gg

Could help to duo queue with someone. If it is someone you know can play well, it can easily mean one less frustratingly bad player. It may also mean you are placed with and against people of higher ELO.
Personally I see very little skill difference between LCS and bronze 5. Its a unique thing to this game. IDK I could say more but I won't.

When I watch LCS I see barely any deaths, for one thing, because the LCS players know when not to try and make plays.

personally i find bronze games are decided by which team gets the first feed player and they snow ball cos bronze doesnt know how to control a feed champ. so i would recommend playing champs that are really good in the early lvls so you can just solo kill your lane opponent, and being bronze they won't think 'hey i just got solo killed maybe i should be more passive and hang back so i dont get killed again'. they will most likely just go straight HAM again wanting to prove there better.
so snow balling from the beginning is the best way out of bronze. 
champs that take time to scale i find to be a fools trap in bronze because your team won't wait for you to. they will go in with out you and then blame you for doing sh!t even tho you havent scaled to do damage yet.  team fighting oriented champs arent the best too because team fights will be scattered and random, best to take good dualists.
in bronze dont rely on your team to win the game for you, unless your support. if you are support you play a support and you protect your adc.
this is are just my opinion.
